title: The good and the bad of plastic bag bans: Research review
body: Researchers at Cardiff University, in the United Kingdom, found that a fee for plastic bags introduced in October 2015 has led to a sharp decline in the number of shoppers who take single-use bags at checkout, from 25 percent to 7 percent after one year. China, which banned many types of plastic bags in 2008, claims some successes.
readable_content: - OnlineSeeker (2023-12-08): This article from Harvard Kennedy School's Shorenstein Center discusses the impact of plastic bag bans, referencing research on their environmental and health effects, legislation, and the potential drawbacks of alternative solutions. It also delves into the challenges of biodegradable plastics and the presence of synthetic compounds in plastic.
